prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Jack Kerouac Collection, Accession #8875, Clifton Waller Barrett Library, Special Collections, University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was purchased by the Library on May 21, 1968.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: In a letter, December 7, 1965, to Marshall Bean, Kerouac states that he works alone and has no secretary to send photographs or answer requests, stresses that the organized loner is a better creative writer, and gives his personal view of God.
